meanings.sent1: The poet ended his poem with a beautiful distichs.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed reading the distichs in the ancient manuscript.
meanings.sent3: The distichs in the book made her smile with their clever rhymes.
meanings.sent4: His distichs were like musical notes dancing on the page.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to write their own distichs for homework.

meanings.definition: A pair of lines of verse, usually rhymed.
meanings.sent1: In the poetry competition, she presented a stunning distichs.
meanings.sent2: The distichs in the song were catchy and easy to remember.
meanings.sent3: The distichs in the play added a touch of humor to the scene.
meanings.sent4: His distichs painted a vivid picture of the sunset over the mountains.
meanings.sent5: The distichs in the old book were written in elegant calligraphy.
